challenges.title: The 7 Day Glute Challenge
challenges.content: Hey guys! It is time‚Ä¶for the 7 Day Glute Challenge!!! That‚Äôs right ‚Äì we‚Äôre gonna commit to working hard for another 7 days, but this time we‚Äôre building and lifting our glutes. Just like the 7 Day Ab Challenge, all you need is 20-30 minutes a day. THAT‚ÄôS IT. We‚Äôre already on a roll, so why stop now? Keep that time carved out each day to work out and let‚Äôs keep getting stronger üí™ You in?! I thought so. Let‚Äôs get started with the #7DayGluteChallenge. Here‚Äôs the graphic that you‚Äôre going to want to print out:
challenges.purpose: To lift and round out your glutes in 7 days!

challenges.title: The 200 Ab Challenge
challenges.content: Hey guys!I know this is kinda last minute, but last week I asked if you wanted a challenge annnnd the consensus was a resounding YES! Actually, I knew you‚Äôd probably be all for it (DUH) but I needed your enthusiasm to get my wheels turning! What did I come up with? üî• The 200 Ab Challenge üî• Over the next 20 days, we‚Äôre gonna work on ab strength and leaning out the entire body. You ready?!
challenges.purpose: To form Abs while engaing our whole body
challenges.Commitment: We‚Äôre doing 200 reps every day: 100 reps of an ab move AND 100 reps of a cardio move.

challenges.title: Hot Girl Sculpt
challenges.content: Hey guys! Welcome to your #HotGirlSummerSculpt! This is your official 14-day guide. To build strength, to fuel your body, and to TRANSFORM in more ways than you might think. The work we put in together will sculpt your body on the outside, buuuuuut the work doesn‚Äôt stop there. This transformation is going to be about so much more than just fitness. It‚Äôs going to be about rediscovering and growing your confidence too! Because guess what? You are ALREADY a hot girl. And it‚Äôs time to let her shine.
challenges.purpose: We‚Äôll target different muscle groups each day, with one ‚Äúrest‚Äù day where we do a Hot Girl Power Walk.
challenges.Commitment: You‚Äôll be committing to 30 minutes of exercise every single day! And don‚Äôt worry, I have all the workouts ready to go for you!

hair.title: F.A.Q. // ‚ÄúDo I need to wash my hair before my hair appointment?‚Äù
hair.paragraph1: I recently had an appointment to have my hair colored and shared that I used a purifying shampoo the morning of my appointment. I received so many questions about why I did that in my DM‚Äôs on Instagram that I decided to break it all down here. 'I thought oily hair made the color stick better?'
hair.paragraph2: ‚ÄúMy stylist always told me dirty hair was better for coloring?‚Äù
hair.paragraph3: ‚ÄúWhy would you wash it if it‚Äôs just going to get washed at the salon?‚Äù
hair.paragraph4: Before I dive in, I feel like I need to remind you that you need to listen to your own stylist if he or she directs you otherwise. I am a professional with years of experience (even though I‚Äôm not behind the chair right now) and this is my opinion.
hair.paragraph5: If you are going to see your stylist for a haircut, it‚Äôs not necessary to wash your hair. The only case that could justify washing your hair is if it‚Äôs loaded up with dry shampoo or texture spray and it will be too challenging to brush out. In that case, it could be really helpful for you to wash it and brush it out yourself. If you are going to see your stylist for color, it‚Äôs better to arrive with clean, dry hair. The reason behind this is that it preps the hair to fully absorb whatever color service you are having done without the barrier of dry shampoo, texture powder, oil, etc. If your hair is covered in hair product (which is a chemical), how do you expect the hair color (also a chemical) to respond? In most cases, it‚Äôll all work out fine, but arriving at your appointment with clean dry hair gives the color the greatest opportunity for success.
hair.paragraph6: Imagine painting on a canvas covered in dust, grime, and other junk. You could get the job done, but it may not be as pure as it would have been if the canvas was totally clean. So, if you‚Äôre able to wash your hair prior to getting it colored, even simply the night before, it‚Äôll certainly help set your stylist and the color up for success. If you aren‚Äôt able, your stylist should know whether or not he or she needs to prep your hair with a wash or if it‚Äôs safe to simply apply the color directly to your hair.
hair.paragraph7: In order to avoid confusion, if you‚Äôre going in for JUST a haircut, it‚Äôs okay to skip washing prior to your appointment. Your stylist may prefer to cut your hair dry, or simply want to wash it themselves. Also, washing your hair and showing up to your appointment with wet hair will not lead to a lower price of the service either!

hair.title: A Dressed Up Pony
hair.paragraph1: Let's face it. We all have days we don't want to wash our hair and wearing it down won't work, so we throw up it up into a ponytail. Instead of an ordinary pony, you've got to try this style.
hair.paragraph2: 1. Part your hair from ear to ear, and clip the front part up.
hair.paragraph3: 2. Put a ponytail in the bottom half of the hair.
hair.paragraph4: 3. Release the clipped section, and with the hair parted where you choose, take one side and bring it over to the other side of the ponytail and under, pinning it underneath to secure it.
hair.paragraph5: 4. Take the other side of hair and bring it over the ponytail and pin it underneath.
hair.paragraph6: 5. Clean up any loose pieces under the ponytail by pinning in place.
hair.paragraph7: This style works best on medium-length hair, looks amazing and takes minutes to achieve!

hair.title: Sun Protection for your Hair
hair.paragraph1: I feel like everyone knows by now how important SPF is for our skin, but I‚Äôm not so sure the same sun protection measures are being taken on our hair!
hair.paragraph2: Sun, pollution, humidity, salt water, chlorine, and anything else that comes with summertime activities, can all be rough on hair. I have to be extremely mindful of how I care for my hair in the summertime because I have a lot working against me.
hair.paragraph3: I heat style regularly, I wash often, I color my hair, I have well water, and we have a pool in the backyard. So if I don‚Äôt baby my hair in the summertime (frankly, year-round), it‚Äôll simply break off at the ends.
hair.paragraph4: I always wash my hair after I get out of the pool. Sometimes immediately after, and other times it‚Äôll be a few hours after depending on what we have going on. I typically apply a hair mask or at the very least I‚Äôll add in a leave-in conditioner and let my hair air dry.
hair.paragraph5: But before all of this, before I get in the sun, I take a few steps to take care of my hair. More often than not I‚Äôll wear a hat. And I just bought a few scarves on amazon to try this summer to cover my hair when I‚Äôm out by the pool. As far as hair products go, I love the Bumble and Bumble Hairdressers Invisible Oil UV protection line. I‚Äôve been using the primer for months, and really love the hyaluronic acid leave-in treatment too. I also rounded up a few other UV protection hair products to pack in your pool or beach bag this summer and included a recommendation for what to apply afterward too.

hair.title: I Tested 3 Popular Dry Shampoo Sprays, and Here are My Thoughts
hair.paragraph1: I have a lot of thoughts on dry shampoo, so buckle up. I like dry shampoo, I do, but I think a bit more education and awareness about it could help make the use of it better for hair and scalp health! As always, your personal hairstylist is the best option for discussing your scalp health, dry shampoo use, etc. since that person sees you regularly. I hope this post gives you a few tips, and you leave with a recommendation or two for dry shampoo!
hair.paragraph2: Dry shampoo is a really fantastic option for extending the life of your hairstyle to skip a wash day. Not only is this a time-saver, but it can save your hair from a bit of heat styling as well! There are so many different kinds, and it really takes a bit of trial and error to find a system that works for you. Dry shampoo can help soak up oil, leaving the hair both feeling and looking cleaner, as well as adding a little lift and texture to the roots of your hair. I‚Äôve never loved dry shampoo. It‚Äôs FINE, but I‚Äôve always leaned more towards making time for a wash and fresh style instead of trying to ‚Äúfix‚Äù two-day-old hair. Call me old-fashioned, but it‚Äôs just what I preferred.
hair.paragraph3: I did discover a product that I really loved in the summer months a few years ago by Bumble and Bumble which was the perfect post-workout ‚Äúdry‚Äù shampoo mist. I used quotation marks because it was a wet spray, but dang it really helped refresh my hair to a manageable level after a very, very sweaty workout. The Pret-a-Powder Post Workout Dry Shampoo mist was my go-to to spray on my sweaty hair, let it sit, and then blow dry on a day I wasn‚Äôt interested in styling my hair. Usually, it was in a ponytail anyway, but that product helped it look better. It does have a strong scent, so keep that in mind.  Over time, I would occasionally, and I mean occasionally, use dry shampoo, but I never felt super attached to it.
hair.paragraph4: I was at a hair appointment a few months ago and my stylist wondered out loud if I was burning my hair a bit through the use of heat, which was contributing to the darker blonde that would occur over time. I certainly use a lot of heat on my hair, but even with heat protection and deep conditioners and repairing treatments, the temperature of the tools can still dramatically affect your hair.
hair.paragraph5: Living Proof Dry Shampoo ($28) ‚Äì it should shock no one that this was the clear winner for me. Living Proof has just absolutely nailed dry shampoo. It works, it makes my hair feel full and fresh, it‚Äôs got a light scent, and it didn‚Äôt cause my scalp to itch. I was so pleased with the volume that lasted all day from this dry shampoo. I know they have the Advanced Clean Dry Shampoo as well, which I haven‚Äôt tried yet but people seem to really love it.
hair.paragraph6: Amika Perk Up Dry Shampoo ($26) ‚Äì this is a really nice option for someone who found Living Proof Dry Shampoo to be too intense/gritty. This feels like nothing in your hair, in the best way possible, but don‚Äôt expect it to add volume or lift.
hair.paragraph7: Batiste Dry Shampoo, Bare Fragrance (under $10) ‚Äì this was another great option for a barely-there scent and lightweight finish. I got zero lift/volume from this product, so if you‚Äôre not looking for volume on day 2 or 3, and prefer a minimal scent, this would be a nice option!

hair.title: Create curls with flat iron
hair.paragraph1: Soft Bends with a Flat Iron
hair.paragraph2: I feel very comfortable making waves with a curling iron, but I wanted to push myself out of my ‚Äúautopilot‚Äù mode and create some soft, undone waves with the flat iron.
hair.paragraph3: I‚Äôve been using GHD flat irons for years, both in the salon and at home, and while they don‚Äôt give you options to adjust heat, they are some of the fastest, smoothest, highest-performing irons out there.
hair.paragraph4: I used the new GHD Platinum+ iron for these waves (this is not a sponsored post, but the brand did gift me this iron). It‚Äôs fantastic. It has a top heat of 365 degrees, which is safe for most hair, and an auto-shutoff after 30 minutes. The beveled edge of the plates means it smooths through the hair effortlessly, which is essential for a ‚Äúone and done‚Äù pass through the hair. Repeatedly ironing over a section of hair can cause damage, so if you‚Äôre able to get a smooth, straight effect (or a wave!) with one glide against the hair, that‚Äôs a sign of a great iron.
hair.paragraph5: In the video, I used the GHD Platinum+ iron, the Cricket Pro-35 comb, Virtue Healing Oil for the ends, and Amika Un.Done Volume and Matte Texture Spray for texture and grit. Prior to the start of the video, I used Bumble and Bumble Hairdresser‚Äôs Invisible Oil Ultra Rich Hyaluronic Treatment Lotion, as well as Aquage Uplifting Foam on my roots for lift.
hair.paragraph6: In my experience, this is one of those hairstyles that looks different every time you try it. Some days it‚Äôs softer waves, other days you‚Äôll have a stronger bend. A lot depends on how you prep the hair, how quickly your iron flows through the sections, and what finishing products you use as well.
hair.paragraph7: If you are more of a curling iron person and are looking for curls to last all day, this tutorial should be a huge help for you!

hair.title: Top Hair Color Trends of 2022
hair.paragraph1: Playful colors are all the rage for this year's hair trends. We encourage our readers to not shy away from color, and instead be bold and experiment with a glossy, multidimensional hue! We‚Äôve rounded up 24 of the hottest hair color trends for the year; some are subtle if you are looking for a natural look, and others are statement-making! Kick off the season with a fresh, new do by trying out one of the trends below.
hair.paragraph2: Holographic hair resembles a CD when you hold it to the light and refracts a rainbow of blue, yellow, purple and green hues. To achieve this colorful mane you will need to start with a blonde base and work with a stylist that is experienced at blending multiple colors seamlessly. All that time in the salon chair is worth it to achieve this cool, futuristic look. We suggest rocking a fishtail ponytail to accentuate the mix of colors in your hair.
hair.paragraph3: Rose gold hair has been all the rage, and rightfully so! This pink tinted hue looks great on blonde or brown hair. You can rock all over color, highlights or just dye the ends of your hair. If you have ombre from last season this is the perfect upgrade to light up your look and ensure you look radiant this summer.
hair.paragraph4: Color melting is when you combine multiple tones for a seamless hair color from your roots to tips. This fluid movement of colors is irresistible and would look glam with full, bouncy waves.
hair.paragraph5: This vivacious copper color is beautiful and impactful! To keep your fiery red hue, make sure to use shampoo and conditioner specifically for color treated hair.

hair.title: Hair extantions
hair.paragraph1: Human hair extensions are exactly what they sound like. They are made out of real, human hair from top to bottom, collected from a donor. Remy hair means all the cuticles (the outer layer of the hair) are intact, running in the same direction at the time of collection. This allows for almost no tangling and ensures that the extensions remain smooth and silky throughout their lifetime.  Synthetic hair, on the other hand, is made out of various synthetic, blended fibres, and contains no human hair. These fibres are usually very fine, plastic fibres that are manufactured to imitate real human hair.
hair.paragraph2: Both real and synthetic extensions come in many styles, colours, and different forms of application. The quality of synthetic fibres can vary, but they are generally stiff and move differently from human hair, so they don‚Äôt blend as well with your natural hair. They sometimes have a wiry or coarse feel to the touch. Real hair looks and feels real (because it is!) and therefore blends more naturally with your hair.
hair.paragraph3: Human hair extensions can be treated just like your own natural hair. You can straighten, curl, blow dry, color them, and apply hair products. With synthetic hair, you cannot color the hair as most dyes contain ammonia or bleach, which would destroy the synthetic hair. Additionally, you cannot style synthetic hair the same way as your real hair because heat can damage them so curling irons, straighteners and blow dryers are a no go, as they will melt or severely damage the hair. Other factors such as sun, friction, or harsh hair products can also damage synthetic hair extensions.
hair.main4: QUALITY & HOW LONG HAIR EXTENSIONS LAST
hair.paragraph4: Synthetic hair is cheaper than real hair, but of course with that, comes a trade-off. Because they‚Äôre made out of synthetic fibres, they do not last as long as human hair as they can easily be damaged by the above-mentioned factors (sun, heat, etc.) Generally, synthetic hair extensions last for a few months, whereas human hair extensions can last upwards of one year if they are well taken care of. Luxy Hair remy human hair extensions last for about one year on average.

makeup.title: Drugstore Makeup Dupes That Are Just as Good as Luxury Products
makeup.paragraph1: Drugstore makeup dupes are everywhere. If you‚Äôve got your pulse on the beauty industry or scrolled any TikTok beauty threads lately, you‚Äôve likely heard makeup lovers rave about cult favorites like Nars Creamy Concealer, Charlotte Tilbury Flawless Filter, or the Fenty Beauty‚Äôs Gloss Bomb. And just in case you‚Äôre wondering, these makeup products are as good as they say. But stocking up on these high-end holy-grail finds can get expensive.  The good news: There are often drugstore products that do a comparable job at half the price‚Äîyou just need to know which ones are the hidden gems.   With that in mind, we put together a list of our favorite high-end makeup products and found the best drugstore makeup dupes that give similar results. Below you'll find dupes for foundation, concealer, bronzer, highlighter, and more. What‚Äôs better than a luxury look with a drugstore price?
makeup.paragraph2: Nars Light Reflecting Foundation gives you a natural finish. Although it's a splurge, the flawless base layer and full coverage are well worth the price.  L‚ÄôOreal Infallible gives you a great matte finish. You might be worried that a foundation that holds this well will be heavy, but we find it to be breathable and lightweight. It goes on smoothly (and once you apply it, it‚Äôs there to stay for the long haul).
makeup.paragraph3: Charlotte Tilbury has become one of the most popular beauty brands over the past few years, and the Flawless Filter is particularly famous on #beautytok. It provides sheer coverage, a beautiful glow, and it‚Äôs a great foundation for oily skin. According to TikTok‚Äôs Mikayla Nogueria (and other makeup influencers), E.L.F‚Äôs Halo Glow Liquid Filter is an exact dupe for the CT‚Äôs Flawless Filter. She says, ‚ÄúThere is pretty much zero difference.‚Äù If you‚Äôre looking to save money on this step of your makeup routine but still want a glowy, sheer look with adaptable shade coverage, try the E.L.F. option.
makeup.paragraph4: Nars‚Äôs radiant creamy concealer seems like everyone‚Äôs go-to concealer, especially for dark circles. When shopping for a new concealer, my Sephora advisor pointed me into Nars territory. The product lives up to its name and is indeed creamy. It goes on easily and conceals for hours at a time without having to reapply. When it comes to drugstore products, Revlon is one of the best drugstore brands. Its Photo Ready Candid concealer is one of the best drugstore concealers because it provides long-lasting and brightening coverage. You can build it up or use it sparingly for light application, and similar to the Nars version, it has a creamy formula.
makeup.paragraph5: If you‚Äôre looking for a glowing, bright blush, look no further than Ilia‚Äôs multi-stick. It brightens cheeks with beautiful pink and red hues, and the shades can be layered depending on how many colors you're looking for. The wide range of colors means there are options for many different skin tones. Bonus: You can use it as a lip tint or eyeshadow if you want. Fan-favorite E.L.F makes a similar multi-stick that makes for a great blush. This blendable stick goes on easily for a shimmery finish, and the product is so creamy that it's almost indistinguishable from its luxury sister. And, similarly to Ilia, this stick can be used for more than just blush.
makeup.paragraph6: Lanc√¥me‚Äôs Lash-Lifting and Volumizing Mascara helps you achieve that false-lash look with the swoop of a wand; it's a high-end mascara that will help lift and lengthen your lashes. It stays on long and doesn‚Äôt smudge. A few months ago, I wandered into Ulta before a wedding, needing a great mascara‚Äîbut I wasn‚Äôt looking to spend a lot. The Ulta advisor immediately brought me the Lash Princess False Lash Effect Mascara and WOW‚ÄîI was impressed. It‚Äôs been my go-to for dramatic, long lashes ever since. My lashes appear 10 times longer, and the formula goes on clump-free. I recently got my makeup done professionally and was delighted to see the makeup artist was using this product too.
makeup.paragraph7: One of the many gifts that Rihanna has blessed us with is Fenty Beauty, and the Gloss Bomb Universal Lip Luminizer helps you achieve Riri‚Äôs glossy lip look in a single swipe.  But I'll be honest: Lip gloss is one of the places I look to save money in my makeup routine. I am usually reapplying it a few times throughout my day (after meals, after happy hour, you get it). Beauty By Artrice on TikTok let me in on a great secret: Revlon‚Äôs Super Lustrous The Gloss is an amazing, affordable version of Fenty‚Äôs Gloss Bomb. The shades are great, leave lips shiny, and don't break the bank.

makeup.title: The Best Lip Balms, Lipsticks, and Lip Glosses of 2022
makeup.paragraph1: With so many different lip balms, glosses, and lipsticks out there, it can be difficult to choose a product that is just right for you. Some are too cakey, too dehydrating, or transfer onto every straw, cup, and fork that your lips touch, which is obviously not ideal. Out of thousands upon thousands of products submitted by brands (we‚Äôre not exaggerating), we found the 13 best lip products for our 2022 Healthy Beauty Awards. Our selections were based on dermatologists‚Äô criteria. Then, each and every product was vetted by over 50 testers including SELF editors, doctors, dermatologists, influencers, parents, and more.  You‚Äôll find that these 13 lip products are long-lasting, transfer-proof, and complimentary to your unique skin tone‚Äìqualities any great makeup product should have. Read on to see all of our winners, and check out the other 2022 Healthy Beauty Award winners here.
makeup.main2: 1. Best Everyday Lipstick: Merit Signature Lip Lightweight Lipstick
makeup.paragraph2: Laying your hand on a sheer lipstick that‚Äôs long-lasting and smudge-proof can feel like finding a needle in a haystack. Consider Merit‚Äôs Signature Lip Lightweight Lipstick your needle. It‚Äôs essentially three lip products in one: a sheer lipstick, a satin lipstick, and a lip balm. It contains hydrating ingredients like raspberry and sunflower seed oil, which lock in moisture so your lips stay hydrated during windy days and dry summer nights. The satin finish adds a natural shine to your lips without the stickiness of a gloss. Even better, the formula is buildable if you‚Äôre craving a more dramatic makeup look. Merit‚Äôs lipstick is so lightweight, you‚Äôll forget you‚Äôre wearing it. Bonus points, per the experts: A quality sheer lipstick will leave your lips feeling rehydrated and provide you with a lasting shine. Merit‚Äôs lipstick contains squalane, a dermatologist-recommended ingredient for not only moisturizing the skin, but making sure that moisture stays in. One tester said: ‚ÄúHoly grail, full stop. My new go-to lipstick because of the shade range and texture. This lipstick is the middle ground of everything, the perfect combination of qualities that you‚Äôd want in an easy everyday pick.‚Äù
makeup.main3: 2. Best Lip Mask: Marie Hunter Rose Lip Mask
makeup.iparagraph3: Dry lips needing some TLC? Marie Hunter‚Äôs rose-scented lip mask will provide your lips with all the tender loving care they need. With a texture that glides over your lips like butter, this lip mask will have your lips feeling silky smooth. One tester raved about how the lip mask was the solution to her perpetually dry lips. No wonder, as the mask is made with shea butter, castor oil, and coconut oil, which come together for ultra-hydrating power. This mask melts from a balm into an oil, so all you have to do is apply and tell dry lips, ‚ÄúGoodbye!‚Äù  Bonus points, per the experts: Thanks to alpha hydroxy acids (AHAs), this lip mask offers gentle exfoliation and is safe for sensitive skin. One tester said: ‚ÄúThis lip mask was a game changer. It provides long-lasting hydration and makes my lips feel like silk. It has a natural-looking pink tint to it that‚Äôs perfect for a no-makeup makeup look. It‚Äôs lightweight and has a slight rose scent.‚Äù
makeup.main4: 3. Best Lip Liner: Makeup by Mario Ultra Suede Sculpting Lip Pencil
makeup.paragraph4: Sculpt, shape, and slay your next lip look with none other than Makeup by Mario‚Äôs precision lip pencil. A true expert in the makeup world, celebrity makeup artist Mario Dedivanovic hones years of experience into the making of this liner. The dual ended matte liner provides full coverage and zero bleeding or feathering, which makes it perfect for beginners and professionals. There are 19 shades to choose from, and countless looks you can create. Bonus points, per the experts: This lip pencil contains iron oxides, which are commonly used in sunscreen to help block UVA and UVB radiation from the sun. One tester said: ‚ÄúLeave it to Mario Dedivanovic to completely reinvent lip liner. This dual ended lip pencil features a pencil on one end and a flat lip brush on the other. I love using the brush to feather in the lip pencil to fill in my lips. The brush is great for cleaning up around the lip line. I love the color Kelley. I‚Äôll be wearing it religiously in the fall.‚Äù
makeup.main5: 4. Best Luxury Lipstick: Chanel Rouge Allure L‚ÄôExtrait High-Intensity Refillable Lip Color
makeup.paragraph5: Live in the lap of luxury while wearing Chanel‚Äôs Rouge Allure L‚ÄôExtrait High-Intensity Refillable Lip Color. Chanel never disappoints when it comes to pigmentation: All it takes is one swipe for your lips to be adorned with ultra-rich color. Plus, each one of the gold tubes is refillable, so you won‚Äôt have to worry about buying an entirely new lipstick after you run out. The lip color, which lasts for up to eight hours, has a satin finish but is not overly glossy or wet-looking, according to one tester. Though this lipstick costs $55, your lips will look and feel like a million bucks. Bonus points, per the experts: Jojoba is a popular ingredient in skin and hair care products, but you‚Äôll also find it in Chanel‚Äôs Rouge Allure L‚ÄôExtrait. A true moisturizing ingredient, jojoba is the holy grail when it comes to sealing in moisture. One tester said: ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄúHow can I even begin to describe the luxury experience of using Chanel lipsticks? Everything from the packaging to the actual product feels like such a treat. I love the way this lipstick easily pops open, and clicks back down‚Äîit‚Äôs a great design. Okay, on to the colors. These colors are RICH. They are highly pigmented, and have just enough sheen/semi-gloss to them. They made my lips look instantly hydrated and the color stayed put.‚Äù
makeup.main6: 5. Best Lip Crayon: Revlon ColorStay Matte Lite Crayon
makeup.paragraph6: Rain, sleet, snow, or shine, all 12 shades of this matte lip crayon by Revlon will stay on your lips. Here, Revlon delivers a smudge-proof, flake-proof, life-proof crayon lipstick that incorporates mango seed oil to replenish your lips for all-day wear. The built-in sharpener and lightweight design make the lip crayon perfect if you‚Äôre on-the-go. Its pointed tip ensures precise and simple application. Bonus points, per the experts: Packed with iron oxides, Revlon‚Äôs lip crayon will help protect your lips against harmful UVA- and UVB-radiation, which is especially important during the summer. One tester said: ‚ÄúI am beyond impressed with this lip product. Not only is it budget-friendly, but it‚Äôs also far more long-lasting than any expensive lip crayons/stains/sticks I‚Äôve tried. Even better is the barely-there formula. It was non-sticky, pigment-packed, and oh-so-light. I honestly forgot I even had product on my lips. Bonus points for the velvety-smooth texture too. This is a definite new holy grail of mine.‚Äù
makeup.main7: 6. Best Matte Lipstick: Kylie Cosmetics Matte Liquid Lipstick
makeup.paragraph7: Non-drying and matte lipstick are two phrases that are often not in the same sentence‚ÄîKylie Cosmetics Matte Liquid Lipstick changes that. This lipstick includes all of your must-haves: Its formula is non-sticky and feather-proof; it lasts for eight hours; the doe foot applicator allows you to precisely shape your lips; and the one-swipe colors set quickly without drying you out. Did we mention it‚Äôs highly pigmented? One tester said: ‚ÄúAlthough matte, the lipstick did not make my lips cracked or dry and I was able to use it the whole day without it budging. It‚Äôs long-lasting, sets quickly, and needs minimal reapplication‚Äîif any. The highly pigmented lip kit with the liner makes for an idealistic pout. It‚Äôs great for special occasions or everyday wear.‚Äù

makeup.title: Ariana Grande‚Äôs New R.E.M. Beauty Drop Offers Vibrant Lipsticks for the Summer
makeup.paragraph1: Following Ariana Grande‚Äôs second drop this past spring, the third installment of R.E.M. Beauty was released today. This new beauty drop is titled Chapter 3: on your collar, and it‚Äôs full of the lip product essentials you‚Äôll want this summer. Grande‚Äôs approach to makeup can be boiled down to two words: classic nostalgia. The singer embodies elegance while simultaneously channeling the retro eras of the ‚Äô50s and ‚Äô60s‚Äîalmost always modeled by a high ponytail, a cat eyeliner, and a bold lip. For this newest line, R.E.M. Beauty lets us into Ariana‚Äôs secret: Her lips always take the center stage.  The collection has been created to provide endless mix-and-match lip wardrobing options with five new products‚Äîa classic lipstick, a liquid-to-matte lipstick, lip liner, lip oil, and lip balm‚Äîall of which are available in plush and plump textures and in throwback and future-forward colors. You‚Äôll also be delighted to see that the new lip items are available in cream, liquid to matte, cushiony and hydrating finishes. It‚Äôs a collection that has a bit of everything for everyone, and isn‚Äôt that Grande‚Äôs approach to just about everything she does? Oh, and FYI: The price point ranges from $14 to $19‚Äîcould this be even better? Heard enough? We get it. You like it, you want it, you got it. Let‚Äôs get into the deets of each lip product from this new Ariana Grande R.E.M. Beauty drop.
makeup.main2: R.E.M. Beauty On Your Collar Matte Lipstick
makeup.paragraph2: The classic lipstick is available in ten captivating shades that range from a beige rose called Kiss Me, to a dark berry red Heartbreaker. Get a satin finish with this rich and creamy formula. You only need one stroke for it to look beautifully vivid. It‚Äôs infused with milk thistle and hydrolyzed collagen, both of which are lauded for their ultra-hydrating properties. The brand recommends prepping your lips with a thin layer of its Everything Nice lip balm to create a smooth canvas.
makeup.main3: R.E.M. Beauty On Your Collar Liquid Lipstick
makeup.paragraph3: A game-changing liquid lipstick, this supercharged pick will take away your transfer woes. The color lasts up to 16 hours without fading or transferring. Can we get a yuh to that? It‚Äôs also formulated with a proprietary polymer technology that glides on with a weightless texture. Although it has a quick-drying matte finish, it doesn‚Äôt dry out lips, a rare and positive feature among its class. Additionally, it has an infusion of hydraberry that is known for its optimal hydration properties. It is available in nine shades: warm peach, nude wifey, tan rose, hottie brown nude, and yummm chestnut rose.
makeup.main4: R.E.M. Beauty At The Borderline Lip Liner Pencil
makeup.paragraph4: Create fuller looking lips with these stunning high pigment liner pencils. As would only be right, each liner pairs perfectly with both the matte liquid lipsticks and classic cream lipsticks collections, but that doesn‚Äôt mean you need to follow any rules. Mixing and matching is always more fun. The liner is formulated with next gen waxes that have a creamy feel, gliding onto your lips seamlessly. Another thing we love about this liner is that it is a propel repel pencil that has a built-in sharpener.
makeup.main5: R.E.M. Beauty Essential Drip Lip Oil
makeup.paragraph5: Time to get drippy with this non-sticky lip oil. Lipstick might last longer, but you can never go wrong with a bit of shine. This essential drip lip oil delivers a sheer wash of mega glossy shine with a hint of color. It merges the texture of a lip gloss with the benefits of a moisturizing oil, so this the hack you need in your lineup. It‚Äôs made with a derivative of coconut oil for extra hydration. Customize it to your taste and pick your scent of four: pickin petals (sheer peachy pink with rosy scent and chamomile), raspberry drip (sheer raspberry pink with raspberry scent and ashwagandha), mint condition (sheer aquatic blue with minty scent and menthol), and lavender kiss (sheer cool lavender with white tea scent and lavender extract).
makeup.main6: R.E.M. Beauty Everything Nice Lip Balm
makeup.paragraph6: This lightweight balm is your key to soft, smooth, and fuller looking lips. It has a non-greasy formula that is the perfect first step for any multi-layered lip combo. With its clear and dewy finish and soft shimmer, you‚Äôll want to wear this one every day.

makeup.title: The Best Foundations for Every Budget, Skin Type, and Complexion
makeup.main1: What to Look For in a Foundation
makeup.paragraph1: Foundation is aptly named, since it‚Äôs the foundation of your entire makeup look, so it‚Äôs really important to find one that you really love and that matches your skin tone. Most brand websites have a shade finder tool or consultation that can guess your best foundation match. If it doesn‚Äôt match now, it may be wise to keep it for the winter or summer months when your skin changes in tone. Or, you can use it as a spot concealer or more natural contour shade. When it comes to finding the perfect foundation, you want to consider the texture as well as the finish. ‚ÄúWith foundation, it‚Äôs all about viscosity‚Äîhow it feels on the skin, not necessarily how it looks,‚Äù says Cherbonnier. ‚ÄúIf you have dry skin, pick a more wet foundation. For more oily skin, reach for something more magnifying and less liquid-based, like a cream or a powder.‚Äù
makeup.main2: Giorgio Armani Beauty Luminous Silk Foundation
makeup.paragraph2: A makeup artist‚Äôs favorite, Giorgio Armani Luminous Silk Foundation is ideal for anyone with normal to dry skin. The silky-smooth texture makes it easy to blend and offers a lot of coverage while still looking natural and never cakey. ‚ÄúThis is one of the best user-friendly foundations,‚Äù says Cherbonnier. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt mess it up. You can blend it in with your fingers and it‚Äôll still look good. It‚Äôs a no-brainer.‚Äù
makeup.main3: Mac Studio Radiance Face And Body Radiant Sheer Foundation
makeup.paragraph3: This iconic MAC foundation is seen backstage at almost every runway show. It's endlessly flexible: it‚Äôs lightweight yet waterproof, sheer but buildable, and has a gel-like consistency that seamlessly blends into the skin without sinking into the pores. No matter how much you use, it still looks like skin, not makeup, which is why we love it for acne-prone skin that benefits from the buildable coverage.
makeup.main4: Maybelline Fit Me Matte + Poreless Liquid Foundation
makeup.image4: Maybelline Fit Me Matte + Poreless Liquid Foundation
makeup.paragraph4: This is a drugstore foundation gem. It offers medium to full coverage and is available in 40 shades, so there‚Äôs a perfect match for every skin tone. ‚ÄúIt looks flawless,‚Äù says Cherbonnier. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs tons of colors in the range, it goes on beautifully, and gives you great coverage for the price.‚Äù
makeup.main5: Chanel Les Beiges Healthy Glow Foundation
makeup.paragraph5: As the name implies, this foundation gives the skin a gorgeous glow, which is why Cherbonnier recommends it for people with dry skin. If you have oily skin, it may look shiny. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for photoshoots, because it reflects a lot of light. It‚Äôs great for someone with mature skin, and it does look pretty natural for how much coverage it gives.‚Äù
makeup.main6: Bite Beauty Changemaker Supercharged Micellar Foundation
makeup.paragraph6: This foundation was our best foundation winner of Health Beauty Awards for 2020. The best thing about this foundation is that it‚Äôs buildable. You can build up more coverage where you need it or just use a light layer all over the face. ‚Äã‚ÄãIt‚Äôs packed with antioxidant-rich maqui berry to nourish and calm the skin, and the natural radiant finish helps blur imperfections and soften fine lines all day long.
makeup.paragraph7: This liquid foundation is almost too good to be true. It has a thin and almost runny formula, which feels almost undetectable on the skin but still provides stellar medium to full coverage. On top of that, it also provides waterproof coverage that resists sweating and transfer for up to 24 hours. It leaves a natural finish, giving the skin a fresh and hydrated appearance. If you‚Äôre looking for a beautiful all-around drugstore foundation, this would be our top pick.

makeup.title: How to Clean Makeup Brushes With Minimal Effort
makeup.main1: How often should you be cleaning your makeup brushes?
makeup.paragraph1: Because makeup brushes can be such a breeding ground for bacteria, Dr. King recommends washing makeup brushes and sponges at least once per week. ‚ÄúThis is a good policy for tools used in the delicate eye area, and particularly if the tools are used for liquid and cream-based products, which are more likely to become contaminated,‚Äù she says. For tools used with dry powders only (which she says are ‚Äúa more challenging environment for microbes to grow in‚Äù), and those concentrated on other areas of the face like the cheeks and brows, Dr. King says a slightly longer interval between washes is fine‚Äîbut you should still clean them at least every other week. The makeup artists we spoke with suggested the same. When they‚Äôre not working with clients (which requires cleaning after every job), New York‚Äìbased makeup artists Jennifer Nam and Marie Schumacher like to clean their personal brushes with soap water around once a week, and do touch-ups between with a brush-cleaning spray after each use (keep scrolling for suggestions on which to buy). Nam also recommends using rubbing alcohol wipes for more delicate tools like lip brushes. For makeup sponges in particular, NYC makeup artist Holly Gowers recommends cleaning after every single use with liquid soap or bar soap.
makeup.main2: When should you replace your makeup brushes and sponges altogether?
makeup.paragraph2: Everyone seemed to agree that if you treat your makeup brushes right, you can use them faithfully for years without running into issues. ‚ÄúI very rarely throw a brush away,‚Äù Schumacher says, ‚Äúand if it doesn‚Äôt make the cut for my kit any longer, I would usually recycle them by using them for craft art brushes.‚Äù How long your brush will last all depends on how regularly (and intensely) you‚Äôre using it, as well as how you take care of it between uses. That being said, there are some clear-cut signs it‚Äôs time to throw away a brush. Much like split ends are a reliable sign you need a haircut, splitting brush hairs, or brush hairs falling out, indicate that it‚Äôs time for that brush to head into retirement, according to Nam and Gowers. Another sign is when your brush or makeup sponge begins to emit a foul smell. ‚ÄúWhen your Beautyblender is cracking, or smelling funky, you should replace it,‚Äù Gowers says.  To prolong the life of your brushes, Gowers also recommends cleaning the container that your makeup brushes sit in every once in a while. If you‚Äôre noticing that the bristles on your brushes are getting mangled from being stuffed in the same cramped container all the time, Nam recommends going the extra mile and slipping brush guards ($13, Beautylish) on your brushes to keep them in mint condition.
makeup.main3: The Tools You‚Äôll Need to Clean Makeup Brushes at Home
makeup.paragraph3: There are lots of makeup-brush cleaners on the market that come in a spray form. These are handy and convenient for quick and easy cleanings. However, they‚Äôre not totally necessary to clean your brushes. Another popular option is a liquid brush cleaner‚Äîmore on how to use one below. All of the makeup artists that we spoke with preferred to use liquid brush cleaners on their own brushes. One of Schumacher‚Äôs favorites is the Parian Spirit cleaner, which she uses for quick, daily cleanups. ‚ÄúIt removes and disinfects in one step,‚Äù she says.  Nam adds that one of the few liquid brush cleaning solutions she actually likes is from MAC Cosmetics: ‚ÄúIt disinfects and gets the makeup out quickly, and it dries down pretty fast. My brushes don‚Äôt smell like chemicals, and they feel soft and ready to use again afterwards.‚Äù  Meanwhile, Gowers swears by Cinema Secrets, which is a concentrated, professional-grade option that lasts for a long time since a little goes a long way. ‚ÄúIf you use it properly,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a deeper clean than soap and water.‚Äù She also finds that the formula dries really quickly, preserves brushes longer, and conditions without leaving an oily sheen behind.
makeup.main4: How to Clean Makeup Brushes Using the Step-by-Step Method
makeup.paragraph4: Spray your brush a few times, with the head pointing down to prevent any moisture from seeping into the glue that holds the fibers to the brush body. Swirl your brush against a clean cloth or paper towel to loosen up the pigments.  Air-dry on a flat surface.
makeup.paragraph5: Fill a small bowl with a thin layer of the solution (for super-concentrated options like Cinema Secrets, less is more).  Dip the tip of your brush into the solution. Gently run your brush back and forth on a clean paper towel or a microfiber towel until all the product buildup is loosened up and your brush feels clean. Air-dry your brushes on a flat surface.
makeup.paragraph6: Holding your brushes with the bristles facing down, gently run lukewarm water in the sink and wet the tips of the bristles. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt want the water to get inside the barrel of your brushes because over time it can break down the adhesive that is holding your brush together and possibly erode your brush handles if they are made of wood,‚Äù Nam says. Gowers also notes that you don‚Äôt want to fully submerge the brush bristles, and that you should avoid rinsing under hot water, ‚Äúwhich can loosen up the glue.‚Äù  Add a drop of your soap of choice to a textured cleansing pad (your palm works here as well), and swirl the brush in the soap until it‚Äôs fully lathered up and any pigment or dirt is removed. If you‚Äôre using bar soap, gently rub your makeup brush or sponge into the soap, creating a lather.  Gently squeeze your makeup brush or sponge to remove any excess cleanser or water. Rinse again with clean water, with the bristles facing downward. Gowers notes that again, you don‚Äôt want to fully submerge the brush bristles, and that you should avoid rinsing under hot water.
makeup.paragraph7: Gently squeeze out any excess water, and mold your bristles back into place so they will dry correctly. Lay your brushes flat to dry on a towel or paper towel. Schumacher says that when she does this step, she leaves the brush heads hanging over a table edge, ‚Äúso there‚Äôs air circulating around the entirety of the bristles.‚Äù This will also help your brush dry in its proper shape. Want to speed up the drying process? Nam likes to direct the breeze from a fan at her makeup brushes. Just make sure that you‚Äôre avoiding heat from devices like hair dryers, which can dry out the bristles.

makeup.title: How to Use Eye Shadow Like a Pro
makeup.paragraph1: No, you're not terrible at makeup if you don't know how to use eye shadow. It's just that eye shadow looks can be extremely difficult to master. There are tens of thousands of tutorials online‚Äîif not more‚Äîthat can quickly become overwhelming. And if you're a newbie, applying eye shadow in a way that doesn't just look like you gave yourself a black (or pink‚Ä¶or blue) eye can be a complex and time-consuming process. Many demos detail steps that include applying a primer, a base color, a crease color, a highlight, a glitter‚Äîand on and on it goes. The 30-piece palettes in the beauty aisle don't help to simplify things, either. So we talked to Joey Maalouf, cofounder of The Glam App, and celebrity makeup artist Lindsay Ebbin, cofounder of BeYu Cosmetics, to parse through the classic eye shadow mistakes most people make. Read on to learn how to use eye shadow like you actually know what you're doing‚Äîbecause, after reading this, you will!
makeup.paragraph2: Both of our experts agree that using eye shadow primer is an essential first step. ‚ÄúI think the biggest mistake people make is they don‚Äôt wear a primer or a cream shadow or some type of base before they apply a powdered eye shadow,‚Äù Maalouf tells SELF. Primer has many purposes: It can moisturize dry lids, it helps shadow stay on longer, and it acts like a magnet to stop loose shadow from falling on your cheeks. If you don‚Äôt want to purchase a separate product to put in your makeup kit, you can use a fragrance-free lip balm or salve, or any eye cream as a substitute.
makeup.main3: 2. Mistake: You‚Äôre applying concealer to your lids before shadow.
makeup.paragraph3: While applying a primer is an important step, you can skip color correcting and concealing your lids if you‚Äôre going to apply shadow. ‚ÄúSometimes concealer is too cakey,‚Äù Maalouf says. ‚ÄúThen it changes the color of the eye shadow and it doesn‚Äôt look too good.‚Äù
makeup.main4: 3. Mistake: You‚Äôre applying eye makeup before foundation.
makeup.paragraph4: Both of our experts agree that it's best to apply foundation before any eye makeup. ‚ÄúI start with [taking care of the] skin because it takes the longest, and I think it‚Äôs most important,‚Äù Maalouf says. ‚ÄúInstead of using 19 eye shadows, make your skin look perfect and use one eye shadow.‚Äù
makeup.main5: 4. Mistake: You‚Äôre buying nude shades that ‚Äúmatch‚Äù your skin tone.
makeup.paragraph5: It makes sense on paper: Buy a few nude shades, and they will coordinate with every look you have in mind. But in reality, that's not your best bet for an all-purpose makeup arsenal. In fact, you‚Äôre better off reaching for something metallic to really make your eyes stand out. ‚ÄúPeople get afraid of color, but sometimes a color can actually be less noticeable than a beige or brown,‚Äù Maalouf says. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre instinctually going for your version of neutral, but a metallic bronze or rose gold can be really minimal.‚Äù
makeup.main6: 5. Mistake: You‚Äôre using only a makeup brush to apply eye shadow.
makeup.paragraph6: Brushes aren‚Äôt always required to get a good eye look‚Äîyour fingers are your greatest secret weapon, and can actually do a lot of things even a fancy brush can't. For best results, apply the shadow to the back of your hand first. Then use your middle finger (on your opposite hand) to pick up the product and swipe it across your lids. For a smoky eye effect, apply liner to your lash line and waterline. Then smudge with your index finger.
makeup.main7: 6. Mistake: You think you need four different shades of eye shadow for a proper look.
makeup.paragraph7: Maalouf believes wholeheartedly in a minimal approach to eye shadow. So while those four-step tutorials on Pinterest are gorgeous, you can most definitely get away with using just one shadow shade. ‚ÄúTake a really fluffy eye shadow brush and a matte shadow a couple of shades darker than your natural skin,‚Äù Maalouf suggests. ‚ÄúThen do a haze around your whole eye. When you take your look from day to night, you can add an eyeliner to it.‚Äù That‚Äôs it! Bye, eye shadow palette.

travel.title: Albania photos that will make you book a ticket
travel.paragraph1: These are the views you will be spoilt with just from the roads in the rugged north of Albania. On route from Shkod√´r, and the beautiful Lake Skadar after a Montenegro road trip, you don‚Äôt even need to leave the driving seat for these vistas. Though, when some goats on the road stop you driving, it‚Äôs a pretty awesome excuse to jump out.
travel.paragraph2: Taking a boat tour through Lake Komani provides a million excuse to capture some Albania photos, though don‚Äôt do a Dan and crash/kill your drone into a mountain here. These eco-tours offer you the chance to sleep in a house on the lake, there is no electricity but the home made honey and Rakia, a kick-ass local liquor, will make sleeping in the dark, with just lapping water and clear star filled skies the best reason to have a digital detox.
travel.main3: The rolling green hills of Albania
travel.paragraph3: I can‚Äôt even remember where I took this shot, one of many moments I screamed at Lili in the driver seat to slam on the breaks. The landscapes in Albania are so varied and the countryside of this country is often overlooked for the beaches but drive in land and you‚Äôll find a more local way of life, with all it‚Äôs unique and awesome Balkan oddities.
travel.paragraph4: The UNESCO city of Berat, dubbed as the city of a thousand windows was perhaps my favourite place in the whole country. Here you can sleep inside a castle, explore Ottoman and Byzantine ruins and have an ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt have a clue what you are saying‚Äô debate with a policeman over traffic regulations.
travel.main5: But don‚Äôt just do the coast, visit Gjirokastra
travel.paragraph5: If you do, you‚Äôll miss out on mini adventures to find the waterfalls of Bogove or take in Gjirokastra, a true rival to Berat for the cutest city in Albania. UNESCO listed, it‚Äôs sitting damn pretty in the Drina valley and the scenic drive just to get here is worth doing the side trip for. The Ottoman style houses here, stacked up against the side of the mountain with their white washed walls and slate roofs make for a killer Albania photo moment on Instagram but stick around for a while and wander the small streets hunting out the best Cevapi (small sausage dish) in town. Gijirokastra castle, with is stunning views over the valley, cannons in cobbled hallways and plane wrecks is a great vantage point and was surprisingly free of tourists, even in August. Get a beer in a bar, watch the sunset and feel like you are a million miles away from the modern world whilst snapping another for the Albania photos album you‚Äôre mates will all be jealous of!
travel.paragraph6: Seriously beautiful, but a bitch to photograph. I sent Jones into the freezing water with my GoPro/Dome camera and he got some incredible videos of this bubbling unique natural spot then managed to corrupt the files (I think I‚Äôve forgiven him now).

travel.title: Top things to do in Sri Lanka
travel.paragraph1: Elephants, Monkeys, Leopards, Peacocks and hundreds of birds all live on this wildlife paradise island. With more national parks than you could cram into a two-week vacation, you are spoilt for choice on how to get your animal kick in Sri Lanka. A safari is one of the top things to do in Sri Lanka. Whether it is the most popular park at Yala in the South East for a chance to spot a leopard or to one of the other many parks. Being able to see Elephants in the wild was one of the most beautiful parts of this trip. Monkeys and Chipmunks can be found hanging around everywhere as well as cows and water buffalo holding up the traffic.
travel.paragraph2: Visiting during the off-season on the South coast might bring the odd shower but it certainly didn‚Äôt bring the crowds. The beaches in Sri Lanka are some of the most beautiful, and deserted, I have ever seen. I am sure it won‚Äôt be long, the tell-tale signs of resort development are spreading out from the small hubs it has now. Pick a hotel (The beautiful Aqua Cantaloupe, pictured below) and relax to nothing more than the sound of waves.
travel.paragraph3: For a country previously known as Ceylon, there is one thing to do in Sri Lanka you can‚Äôt miss, Tea. The hill country from Kandy through to Ella is the most famous region to get your Tea fix and visit the beautiful fields of green. The area around Nurwara Eliya is a favourite base to explore plantations and factories not far out-of-town. Mackwoods estate is one of the most famous though the views from Blue Fields a little further along are sublime, The area around Nurwara Eliya is a favourite base to explore plantations and factories not far out-of-town. Mackwoods estate is one of the most famous though the views from Blue Fields a little further along are sublime
travel.main4: The world‚Äôs most scenic Train Journey
travel.paragraph4: Tagging onto the beauty of the Tea Country above, there is even more served up on the journey there. The seven-hour train from Kandy to Ella is one of the most ‚Äòbeautiful train journeys in the world. Usually, I find the press and hype do not live up to the reality but the views are truly breathtaking. Just like these below.
travel.paragraph5: The Dambulla caves are home to five, well, caves. Each of which is decorated with the most detailed of paintings both on the walls and roofs. As well as various sculptures and Buddha‚Äôs these are not to be missed on your Sri Lanka itinerary.
travel.paragraph6: One of the most famous images of Sri Lanka is the rock city of Sigiriya. The ‚ÄòLions Rock‚Äô a historic, UNESCO site which used to house a city atop it is one of the ‚Äòmust-visit sites‚Äô. A little pricey on the entrance front and from an archaeological point of view not so much left to view however once you have reached the tops the views are more than worth it alone.
travel.paragraph7: I haven‚Äôt felt as welcome, safe and warm in a country since my visit to Myanmar last year. Smiles, nods and greetings soon turned into fleeting talking or conversations. From contraband tea dealers to families waiting for the bus. It takes you by surprise how a nation who has been through so much in recent times can shine through with such genuine warmth. A lesson for us all.

travel.title: Sustainable Travel Tips ‚Äì Easy Tips for You to Use Now!
travel.main1: 1. Pick a sustainable travel destination instead of a popular one
travel.paragraph1: A good way to travel sustainably is to choose a smarter holiday destination. Many countries are working towards becoming carbon neutral and Bhutan is the first country to become carbon negative! It‚Äôs better not to follow the latest travel trends, based on popular movies or series. As an example, the Game of Thrones brought fame to Dubrovnik, Croatia. This caused problems for a destination that was not prepared for mass tourism. For instance, increased traffic, deterioration of historical sites, and increasing prices that are driving locals out.
travel.paragraph2: Research accommodations and tours, that you‚Äôre planning to book, based on how ‚Äògreen‚Äô they are. You can normally find this kind of information on their website. Booking responsibly is a positive way to travel sustainably. Many hotels are now involved in green travel programs or donate a percentage of their profits towards environmental action. For instance, Marriot is only using bulk dispensers in bathrooms, to eliminate single-use plastic. Even better, bring your own environmentally-friendly toiletries rather than using the hotel‚Äôs products at all.
travel.paragraph3: Wildlife is one of the best parts of traveling. Sadly, 75% of all wildlife tourism has a negative effect on animals. Taking part in animal entertainment can mean anything as obvious as watching dolphins performing tricks, to riding an elephant. It also applies to entertainment that seems innocent, like feeding an eagle, holding a snake, or trying Luwak coffee. Animal welfare (riding animals) Companies may seem to promote the welfare of the animal. However, there is not enough research to support ‚Äòsafe or humane‚Äô riding of animals. Because of this, it‚Äôs a great idea to research animal-related activities beforehand. Animal feeding . Feeding wild animals is not a good idea, because they may become dependent on food supplies if they are fed by tourists. Looking after wildlife in these ways helps sustain travel for the future.
travel.paragraph4: Respecting the environment ensures the future of sustainable travel. Over time, beautiful natural areas are seeing the effects of mass tourism. For instance, avoid touching ancient temples and recognize that trails and fences are there for a reason. In short: read the signs. Coral bleaching is another worldwide problem. Due to this, only look at the corals from a distance and never touch them. By doing this, coral growth is hoped to increase.
travel.main5: 5. Leave tracks not trash & make travel sustainable
travel.paragraph5: Protect animals and sea life from getting entangled and ingesting plastic toxins, or even prevent microplastics from ending up in our food. It is a relatively simple task to throw your garbage in designated bins. Remember that plastic can take up to 1000 years to decompose! As a result, it‚Äôs best to use compostable alternatives, avoid buying plastic, or travel plastic-free. Positive action, such as picking up litter is a fantastic way to help. Beach clean-ups are happening all over the world, so have a look online to see where your nearest one is. This is a great way to be a part of positive change, help the community and meet new people who are interested in sustainable travel!

travel.title: BUCKETLIST ACTIVITIES FOR AN UNFORGETTABLE TRIP TO PUERTO RICO
travel.paragraph1: So you‚Äôre headed to Puerto Rico and you need some things to do? I‚Äôve got you! I‚Äôve visited countless times and I still believe that Puerto Rico is an incredible travel destination for everyone but especially US Citizens. When people ask me where they should travel WITHOUT a passport, I always recommend this Caribbean island. The best part? There‚Äôs no US passport needed. It was a no-brainer for me years ago before having much international travel experience due to the ease of access, while also having the ability to dive into a new culture. Needless to say, you‚Äôre in store for a great time. Here are some things you can do on your trip to Puerto Rico:
travel.main2: 1.Go Horseback Riding at Campo Rico Ranch
travel.paragraph2: We galloped through lush green farmland on this famous ranch where famous movies like Fast & Furious have been shot. I felt like a kid again as I rode through cornfields under the island sun. You can book ziplining and four-wheeling at the same ranch!
travel.main3: 2. Take Foodie Tour Through Old San Juan
travel.paragraph3: No better way to discover a place than through its food right? Ate my way all the way through old San Juan while learning about the history of the Island. Learned how to make Mofongo, enjoyed some tasty Mallorca sandwiches, and devoured the mango popsicle/paleta you see in the video here. You can‚Äôt miss Senor Paletas!
travel.paragraph4: I got the chance to taste the rum and sip on cocktails in both classic and hidden gems throughout old San Juan on a cocktail tour. I‚Äôm a sucker for a good cocktail so this was the oneeeeeeee! If you‚Äôre going to visit the Bacardi Factory, be sure to plan ahead! I missed out because there was no availability when I arrived.
travel.paragraph5: I‚Äôve been to both Culebra and Icacos Island v√≠a catamaran on separate trips to PR. If you ask me, I personally preferred Icacos! However, both islands are gorg and worth the day trip! If you book the right one, you‚Äôll get unlimited rum punch along with lunch onboard!
travel.paragraph6: Which is a large cave in a limestone cliff out in Aricebe, Puerto Rico. The views are everything and this is definitely more off the beaten path!
travel.paragraph7: If you‚Äôre looking for Afro- Puerto Rican music and culture, then La Bomba music might interest you!  Check out Terraza de Bonanza to experience the lively sounds of La Bomba!

travel.title: WHERE TO STAY IN CORNWALL ‚Äì RANKED BY ACTIVITY
travel.paragraph1: The following activities are grouped into water-based and land-based. In each case, we suggest where to stay in Cornwall depending on what you most want to do. We also suggest a good alternative to help you find the optimal spot for more than one activity.
travel.paragraph2: Fistral Beach in Newquay is one of the best surf spots in the UK. The wide, sandy beach is backed by dunes and faces the rugged Atlantic. Like many Cornish surfing beaches, Fistral‚Äôs west-facing direction exposes it to large swells, perfect for year-round surfing. Though often busy, the 750m-long beach accommodates surfers of all levels. Advanced surfers usually gather at the northern end of Fistral, which is more exposed and promises steeper, faster waves. The Cribbar, Newquay‚Äôs spectacular big wave, is a draw for surfers all over the world. Those less experienced should stick to the southern end of Fistral, which is sheltered somewhat by the Pentire headland. There are some excellent surf schools nearby which provide lessons for beginners. The beach is a few minutes‚Äô walk from the town centre and close to a range of Newquay cottages. Freshen up and head back out for dinner at Rick Stein or watch the sunset with a drink at the popular Fistral Beach Bar.
travel.paragraph3: The maritime town of Falmouth has one of the deepest natural harbours in the world. Combined with a picturesque setting, sheltered waters and a sophisticated network of boat yards, marinas, sail makers and chandlers, it provides one of the UK‚Äôs best sailing destinations.  Aspiring sailors can take a range of courses, from RYA Level 1 to Advanced Seamanship. Those who just want to enjoy the scenery can book a day of sailing aboard a tall ship or a classic Cornish Gaff Cutter. On land, the town itself has plenty to offer. The main promenade is perfect for an afternoon stroll and it‚Äôs well worth visiting Glendurgan Garden and Pendennis Castle as well as the Maritime Museum.
travel.paragraph4: Coasteering has been described as everything you weren‚Äôt allowed to do by the sea when you were a child: scrambling up rock faces, exploring caves, leaping off ledges and diving into the sea. In essence, it involves exploring a coastline at sea level. Think nature trail with added adrenaline.  Coasteering originated among surfers who would scramble along coastlines in search of the best surf spots and later developed into its own sport. Cornwall has a wealth of options on both the north and south coast as well as inland quarries. The stretch from Praa Sands, past Rinsey to Porthleven, is particularly dramatic. Thrillseekers should ask about the engine houses of Wheal Trewavas mine as you may be able to coasteer into the old engine shaft! Back at sea level, look out for herring gulls, cormorants and shags. If you‚Äôre lucky, you may even see a seal or two.
travel.paragraph5: With its wealth of sheltered coves, Cornwall is a fantastic destination for stand up paddleboarding. Beginners should start at Carbis Bay Beach, a mile from St Ives. Unlike Fistral above, Carbis Bay doesn‚Äôt face west and is largely protected from the Atlantic swells. Expect golden sand and glassy water, but do bear in mind that this is the open sea and conditions can change dramatically depending on the weather.  A range of guided tours are available, from beginner classes to ‚Äòclinics‚Äô designed to correct poor technique. You can choose to head into the open water (expect rougher swells) or explore the coastline on a gentler jaunt.  There is much to do in Carbis Bay, but we advise staying in one of the cottages in St Ives and walking or driving in. The larger town will have more choice, especially in shoulder and low season when some bars and restaurants close.
travel.paragraph6: With jagged Atlantic cliffs, sweeping moorland, coastal castles and sandy coves, Cornwall is a walker‚Äôs paradise. It‚Äôs difficult to pinpoint exactly where to stay in Cornwall for the best walks, but you can‚Äôt go wrong with the Lizard Peninsula.  The Lizard Peninsula is the southerly tip of mainland Britain and the coast is accordingly rugged, hewn by the Atlantic. Clifftop walks abound, suitable for all abilities. We recommend The Lizard coastal walk, a 7mi (11km) loop that takes in some of Cornwall‚Äôs most dramatic landscapes, from the far-reaching views at Lizard Point to the coastal idyll of Kynance Cove.
travel.paragraph7: Cornwall isn‚Äôt known for cycling in the same way as surfing, sailing and walking, but there‚Äôs plenty on offer for those on two wheels. We recommend the Penzance cycling loop (70km, 870m elevation gain), which covers some of Cornwall‚Äôs ‚Äì and the UK‚Äôs ‚Äì most famous sights. Starting from Penzance, it takes in the storybook village of Mousehole, the iconic landmark of Land‚Äôs End and the fairytale setting of St Michael‚Äôs Mount. It doesn‚Äôt go quite as far as St Ives, but can be easily extended.  Loop back, freshen up at one of the many comfy cottages in Penzance and then head to dinner at Michelin restaurant The Shore (booking is a must).

travel.title: The Art of Slow Travel (How to HACK Travel 2022)
travel.paragraph1: Slow travel is actually a splendid offshoot of the slow food movement. The slow food movement arose in Italy during the 1980s as fast-food chains like McDonalds attempted to infiltrate and outcompete local businesses. Italy said, no ‚Äì but in Italian (which is really just an overly-emphatic ‚Äòno‚Äô with wild hand gestures), and the slow food movement was born. It emphasises a connection to place and valuing local businesses and their high-quality products over cheap, mass-produced food. Essentially, it‚Äôs a movement of quality over quantity.   Slow travel, then, is a f*ck you to the vacuous Insta-famous travel bloggers and their fast food take on travel. It‚Äôs about throwing your caution to the wind and travelling without a phone.  You prioritise connection with local people over another selfie with the Eiffel Tower. It‚Äôs about sitting in a hole in the wall store on tiny plastic chairs and trying the best soup you‚Äôve ever had in your life. As you look around, the smallest details create an imprint on your mind. So this is what travelling is about. It‚Äôs about writing your own manifesto. Slow travel is the whole reason you hit the road in the first place.
travel.paragraph2: For me, there‚Äôs a mindset shift that is crucial to slow travel. My rigid itinerary would have me up at 6 am to try Trip Advisor‚Äôs best croissant and then shuttle on to the top 10 places you have to see before you die. You then rinse and repeat for 12 exhausting days. It‚Äôs a life-changing experience and then we go back to clocking in and out of the 9 ‚Äì 5. My slow travel itinerary would have me impulsively buy a bus ticket to a town I‚Äôd vaguely heard of. It gives you time to scour local newspapers for some part-time work. There‚Äôs time to learn the recipes of my housemates; eat at local restaurants. It‚Äôs about getting under the skin and becoming part of the fabric of the town. I let my travels genuinely change me.
travel.paragraph3: If the most simple way of describing slow travel is quality over quantity, then I think it becomes clear why you should do it ‚Äì to enhance the quality of your travels! How exactly does travelling slowly enhance the quality of your travelling? I think it prevents traveller burnout. You know the feeling: you get back from an exciting and jam-packed trip more tired than you left. You need a vacation from your vacation!
travel.paragraph4: Yeah, look, the world can feel pretty f*cked. It‚Äôs on fire, it‚Äôs running out of water, plastic is choking turtles, Keeping Up With the Kardashians is in its 20th season‚Ä¶ And yet even as we look on at this slow-moving asteroid of destruction, it can feel like we have very little in our power to change the course of action.  We are too accustomed to next day shipping, international flights, and being able to buy travel experiences like we do new clothes. If I want to go see the Great Barrier Reef, provided I have the money, I can leave tomorrow and see the damn reef. So on the one hand, we know that in order for there to be a Great Barrier Reef in thirty years we need to take drastic action. On the other hand, that round the world ticket just went on sale‚Ä¶  Do you travel fast or travel slow? For the sake of being a responsible tourist, I think you should travel slowly.
travel.main5: Slow Travel and Combating the Travel Blues
travel.paragraph5: I think there is pressure these days to ‚Äòsee it all‚Äô. You might never come back! Quick, make sure you get a selfie and post it to Instagram ‚Äì or you might as well have not come! This need to travel glued to your phone and to tick off destinations keeps you in a constant state of stress. Now while the best travel pushes you, it shouldn‚Äôt leave you feeling like a pile of limp, wet noodles. The fact of the matter is, you are never going to see it all. So you might as well make what you do see worthwhile. Going back to the Great Barrier Reef example: rather than going on one scuba diving trip before flying back to your soul-crushing 9 ‚Äì 5, you could live in Cairns for a few months. You‚Äôre going to beat the travel blues by slowing down; by living somewhere and making a morning routine out of what most people consider a mere bucket list item.
travel.paragraph6: Travelling slowly is simply more enjoyable. Quality is a bit of a sticky, and deceptively unknowable concept. It really asks, what is best?  The dominant cultural messaging for the last few generations was that you needed to see everything, do it all, be well rounded, but don‚Äôt lose your job! This led us to cram ourselves into these rigid little itineraries that leave no room for a regenerating planet ‚Äì or self. Luckily, we‚Äôve said ‚Äòno, it‚Äôs not a phase, mom‚Äô. Slow travel simply feels better.
